body_html:
The reason is that the number of threads is hard-coded in the source code, see [1]. In case you don't know it, TF Lite relies on Eigen and gemmlowp for floating point and integer convolutions respectively.

[1] https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.9/tensorflow/contrib/lite/kernels/internal/optimized/multithreaded_conv.h#L58
body_text:
The reason is that the number of threads is hard-coded in the source code, see [1]. In case you don't know it, TF Lite relies on Eigen and gemmlowp for floating point and integer convolutions respectively.
[1] https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.9/tensorflow/contrib/lite/kernels/internal/optimized/multithreaded_conv.h#L58
body:
The reason is that the number of threads is hard-coded in the source code, see [1]. In case you don't know it, TF Lite relies on [Eigen](http://eigen.tuxfamily.org/) and [gemmlowp](https://github.com/google/gemmlowp) for floating point and integer convolutions respectively. 

[1] https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.9/tensorflow/contrib/lite/kernels/internal/optimized/multithreaded_conv.h#L58
